@dpfrank07 In person and in level-headed FB chat.
@dpfrank07 Interesting tidbit: Less education, not income, correlated to Trump voting. Weakens desperation story. https://t.co/S375iGmBTk
@dpfrank07 There is a lot of fake/4chan, but the (few) Trump voters I've talked to admit he's weak on policy, but love offending liberals.
... problem is about 5% of solving it. Opponents of Trump hoping to influence others should focus on being thoroughly decent, not outraged.
... because the things that fire up the left, like marches and protests, are utterly laden with sanctimony. As usual, understanding the ...
... you want to convince them on policy, you have to neutralize their enmity of left-wing sanctimony. That's going to be hard at scale ...
It's increasingly clear that Trump support is rejection of the D/R status quo. They delight in the offense liberals take at Trump. So if ...
Judiciary Committee staff worked for admin w/out informing bosses. @RepGoodlatte is a nice guy. We'll find out today if he's a pushover.
@kaylin_w What about the people who don't know what "AF" means?!
@msantoriESQ Trying to think of a wisecrack that ties this to Bitcoin-likin' new OMB director @RepMickMulvaney, but I got nuthin'...
@msantoriESQ ...beats them at their own game, but I wouldn't hold my breath.
@msantoriESQ Regulators do regulation full-time and are very good at working the system to advantage. Maybe there's a miracle-OIRA that...
@msantoriESQ This libertarian not fooled. Doesn't do fewer laws. New regs can be huge/multi-faceted, and regs eliminated can be piddling.
Nice articulation of the issues raised by the anti-Muslim E.O. https://t.co/p3heFx2ajJ
@TimothySandefur Quite. Luckily we have a countermajoritatian constitution to help hold the line against what all these "victims" demand!
@lulach_cuardach (See, e.g., Liberty, Statue of) @MarcHochstein
@lulach_cuardach Like food at the store, the majority add to our economy and culture. Turning them away undercuts our values. @MarcHochstein
@Circular_Ruins I believe that the availability heuristic/probability neglect explain that common mental error. @TimothySandefur
@Circular_Ruins I think that's right. Blasé about smoking, fat, car crashes, people freak if a dude in Whereverstan is mad. @TimothySandefur
@TimothySandefur (in the sense of "victim" you propose)
@TimothySandefur E.g., I've seen what most have, but due to knowledge and mental discipline, am not scared. Not a victim. Scared people are.
@TimothySandefur I get the sense of "victim" you argue for, but it doesn't have a meaning useful for law-/policy-making b/c it's subjective.
@lulach_cuardach Yes. But the relevant question is cost. How much do you pay to drive infinitesimal risks down even further? @MarcHochstein
@lulach_cuardach Your grocery store has salmonella in it. Yet you buy food there and eat it. You're not a fool to do so. @MarcHochstein
@TimothySandefur I don't know what all it contains. Its words provide information allowing rational people to put terrorism in perspective.
I'm not sure about the concept of the "emotional thinker," btw, but it felt right in the moment.
Not so stupid. But it only appeals to rationalists. What's needed are words that make emotional thinkers feel as sa… https://t.co/41wQu98n1f

@JosephEToomey @AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney It was a great debate. Thanks.
@JosephEToomey @M_Feeney @AlexNowrasteh That is bad policy, dragooning employers into law enforcement. We like small govt, less regulation.
@M_Feeney The no-match thing is about the general rule barring hiring of ineligible workers, not E-Verify. @JosephEToomey @AlexNowrasteh
@JosephEToomey Hang on. @M_Feeney and @AlexNowrasteh are reading (or pretending to) b/c you finally actually brought something to the table.
@JosephEToomey Helpful! @M_Feeney @AlexNowrasteh
@M_Feeney Well, why send a cite to someone who doesn't read? But, then, how are we understanding these Tweets? @JosephEToomey @AlexNowrasteh
@JosephEToomey @AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney The Federal Register citation, please.
@JosephEToomey That is not a requirement to use E-Verify. @AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney
Alright, @AlexNowrasteh, settle down. @JosephEToomey, would you share the Federal Register or CFR cite to which you refer? @M_Feeney
@AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney I think @JosephEToomey doesn't know that E-Verify use is actually not required of all employers by federal law.
@JosephEToomey Saying it does not make E-Verify "useful." It's a net loser for employers, workers, and consumers. @AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney
Good #Bitcoin blocksize explainer, made slightly urgent by another transaction backlog. https://t.co/CrgHI4xeGK
@AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney @JosephEToomey You've run into a small group here who don't just do what we're told or fall in for symbolism.
@AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney @JosephEToomey Because you seem singularly uninterested in whether or not E-Verify is good policy.
@AlexNowrasteh @M_Feeney Question, @JosephEToomey: Would you support a speed limit that neither saved lives nor energy?
@bitcoinlawyer @CREWcrew ...usurpation of his or her power to consent. Strongest argument: it's a political question. Sad!
@bitcoinlawyer @CREWcrew's is that suing uses their resources, a theory anyone could use to sue anyone! A member of Congress could claim...
@bitcoinlawyer It appears that the answer is No.
